author: Amazon Customer

review: I already have a Chromecast and a Blu Ray player with wifi and streaming capabilities. Unfortunately, I can't stream Prime movies on either -- so I bought the Fire TV Stick. Prime streaming is the only advantage this has over Chromecast. I just like the Chromecast set-up better. It's a personal preference, I know, but I think it's simpler and more intuitive. Also, unlike Chromecast, the Fire TV Stick has to be plugged directly into an outlet. I tried ignoring the directions and plugging it into the USB port on my TV instead--but it doesn't work that way. The USB port didn't give it enough power to stream video without repeatedly pausing to buffer ... over and over again. So I gave in and followed the directions and set it up the right way. The outlet-requirement might not be an issue for some, but the included cord didn't stretch far enough to reach my outlet without some (thankfully minor) rearranging. I used the Fire TV Stick for a few days and then switched back to Chromecast. I'll keep the Fire TV Stick as a back-up and use it if I really want to stream Prime on the TV...but I'm sticking with Chromecast for everything else.
